metadata.Title: CVE-2022-41318 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer over-read was discovered in libntlmauth in Squid 2.5 through 5.6. Due to incorrect integer-overflow protection, the SSPI and SMB authentication helpers are vulnerable to reading unintended memory locations. In some configurations, cleartext credentials from these locations are sent to a client. This is fixed in 5.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 5.6-1ubuntu3
squid-cgi - 5.6-1ubuntu3
squid-common - 5.6-1ubuntu3
squid-openssl - 5.6-1ubuntu3
squid-purge - 5.6-1ubuntu3
squidclient - 5.6-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6-1ubuntu3').
